ayas.arabic: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
ayas.translation: In the name of Allah, most benevolent, ever-merciful.
ayas.transliteration: bismillāhir raḥmānir raḥīm

ayas.arabic: طسٓ ۚ تِلْكَ ءَايَـٰتُ ٱلْقُرْءَانِ وَكِتَابٍ مُّبِينٍ
ayas.translation: TA SIN. THESE are the verses of the Qur'an, and collection of explicit laws,
ayas.transliteration: ṭā sīn ۚ tilka āyātul qur-āni wakitābin mubīn

ayas.arabic: هُدًى وَبُشْرَىٰ لِلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
ayas.translation: A guidance and good tidings for the believers,
ayas.transliteration: hudan wabushrā lil-mu-minīn

ayas.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُقِيمُونَ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَيُؤْتُونَ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَهُم بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ هُمْ يُوقِنُونَ
ayas.translation: Who fulfil their devotional obligations, pay the zakat, and believe with certainty in the life to come.
ayas.transliteration: alladhīna yuqīmūnaṣ ṣalāta wayu-tūnaz zakāta wahum bil-ākhirati hum yūqinūn

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ بِٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ زَيَّنَّا لَهُمْ أَعْمَـٰلَهُمْ فَهُمْ يَعْمَهُونَ
ayas.translation: We make their deeds attractive to those who do not believe in the Hereafter, so that they may wander in perplexity.
ayas.transliteration: innal ladhīna lā yu-minūna bil-ākhirati zayyannā lahum a`mālahum fahum ya`mahūn

ayas.arabic: أُو۟لَـٰٓئِكَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَهُمْ سُوٓءُ ٱلْعَذَابِ وَهُمْ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ هُمُ ٱلْأَخْسَرُونَ
ayas.translation: They are those who will suffer the worst chastisement in this life, and will be the greatest losers in the life to come.
ayas.transliteration: ulā-ikal ladhīna lahum sū-ul `adhābi wahum fil-ākhirati humul-akhsarūn

ayas.arabic: وَإِنَّكَ لَتُلَقَّى ٱلْقُرْءَانَ مِن لَّدُنْ حَكِيمٍ عَلِيمٍ
ayas.translation: You have been conveyed the Qur'an from One all-wise and all-knowing.
ayas.transliteration: wa innaka latulaqqal qur-āna min ladun ḥakīmin `alīm

ayas.arabic: إِذْ قَالَ مُوسَىٰ لِأَهْلِهِۦٓ إِنِّىٓ ءَانَسْتُ نَارًا سَـَٔاتِيكُم مِّنْهَا بِخَبَرٍ أَوْ ءَاتِيكُم بِشِهَابٍ قَبَسٍ لَّعَلَّكُمْ تَصْطَلُونَ
ayas.translation: (Remember) when Moses said to his family: "I see a fire. I shall bring you news from it, or bring an ember that you may warm yourselves."
ayas.transliteration: idh qāla mūsā li-ahlihi innī ānastu nāran sa-ātīkum minhā bikhabarin aw ātīkum bishihābin qabasin la`allakum taṣṭalūn

ayas.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَهَا نُودِىَ أَنۢ بُورِكَ مَن فِى ٱلنَّارِ وَمَنْ حَوْلَهَا وَسُبْحَـٰنَ ٱللَّهِ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
ayas.translation: But when he reached it, a voice called out: "Blessed is He who is in the fire and all around it. Praised be God, the Lord of all the worlds.
ayas.transliteration: falammā jā-ahā nūdiya an būrika man fin nāri wa man ḥawlahā wasubḥānallāhi rabbil `ālamīn

ayas.arabic: يَـٰمُوسَىٰٓ إِنَّهُۥٓ أَنَا ٱللَّهُ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْحَكِيمُ
ayas.translation: O Moses, I am that God, the mighty and all-wise.
ayas.transliteration: yāmūsā innahu anallāhul `azīzul ḥakīm

ayas.arabic: وَأَلْقِ عَصَاكَ ۚ فَلَمَّا رَءَاهَا تَهْتَزُّ كَأَنَّهَا جَآنٌّ وَلَّىٰ مُدْبِرًا وَلَمْ يُعَقِّبْ ۚ يَـٰمُوسَىٰ لَا تَخَفْ إِنِّى لَا يَخَافُ لَدَىَّ ٱلْمُرْسَلُونَ
ayas.translation: Throw down your staff." When he saw it wriggling like a serpent he turned his back and fled without turning (to look). "O Moses," (said the voice), "be not fearful. Surely those sent as messengers do not fear in My presence,
ayas.transliteration: wa-alqi `aṣāk ۚ falammā ra-āhā tahtazzu ka-annahā jānnun wallā mudbiran walam yu`aqqib ۚ yāmūsā lā takhaf innī lā yakhāfu ladayyal mursalūn

ayas.arabic: إِلَّا مَن ظَلَمَ ثُمَّ بَدَّلَ حُسْنًۢا بَعْدَ سُوٓءٍ فَإِنِّى غَفُورٌ رَّحِيمٌ
ayas.translation: Except those who do some wrong but afterwards do good to make up for the wrong. And I am forgiving and merciful.
ayas.transliteration: illā man ẓalama thumma baddala ḥusnan ba`da sū-in fa-innī ghafūrun raḥīm

ayas.arabic: وَأَدْخِلْ يَدَكَ فِى جَيْبِكَ تَخْرُجْ بَيْضَآءَ مِنْ غَيْرِ سُوٓءٍ ۖ فِى تِسْعِ ءَايَـٰتٍ إِلَىٰ فِرْعَوْنَ وَقَوْمِهِۦٓ ۚ إِنَّهُمْ كَانُوا۟ قَوْمًا فَـٰسِقِينَ
ayas.translation: Put your hand in the bosom of your shirt; it will come out white without any blemish. This will be one of nine tokens for the Pharaoh and his people, who are a wicked lot indeed."
ayas.transliteration: wa-adkhil yadaka fī jaybika takhruj bayḍā-a min ghayri sū-ī ۖ fī tis`i āyātin ilā fir`awna waqawmih ۚ innahum kānū qawman fāsiqīn

ayas.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَتْهُمْ ءَايَـٰتُنَا مُبْصِرَةً قَالُوا۟ هَـٰذَا سِحْرٌ مُّبِينٌ
ayas.translation: And when Our signs came as distinct proofs, they said: "This is only magic."
ayas.transliteration: falammā jā-at hum āyātunā mubṣiratan qālū hādhā siḥrun mubīn

ayas.arabic: وَجَحَدُوا۟ بِهَا وَٱسْتَيْقَنَتْهَآ أَنفُسُهُمْ ظُلْمًا وَعُلُوًّا ۚ فَٱنظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ ٱلْمُفْسِدِينَ
ayas.translation: And they denied them out of malice and pride, though in their hearts they believed that they were true. So see how was the end of evil-doers!
ayas.transliteration: wajaḥadū bihā wastayqanat-hā anfusuhum ẓul-man wa`uluwwā ۚ fanẓur kayfa kāna `āqibatul mufsidīn

ayas.arabic: وَلَقَدْ ءَاتَيْنَا دَاوُۥدَ وَسُلَيْمَـٰنَ عِلْمًا ۖ وَقَالَا ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ٱلَّذِى فَضَّلَنَا عَلَىٰ كَثِيرٍ مِّنْ عِبَادِهِ ٱلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
ayas.translation: We gave David and Solomon knowledge; and they said: "All praise be to God who has favoured us over many of His creatures who believe."
ayas.transliteration: walaqad ātaynā dāwūda wasulaymāna `il-mā ۖ waqālal ḥamdu lillāhil ladhī faḍḍalanā `alā kathīrin min `ibādihil mu-minīn

ayas.arabic: وَوَرِثَ سُلَيْمَـٰنُ دَاوُۥدَ ۖ وَقَالَ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ عُلِّمْنَا مَنطِقَ ٱلطَّيْرِ وَأُوتِينَا مِن كُلِّ شَىْءٍ ۖ إِنَّ هَـٰذَا لَهُوَ ٱلْفَضْلُ ٱلْمُبِينُ
ayas.translation: Solomon was heir to David, and he said: "O people, we have been taught the language of Tair, and have been given of everything. This is a clear favour indeed."
ayas.transliteration: wawaritha sulaymānu dāwūd ۖ waqāla yā-ayyuhan nāsu `ullimnā manṭiqaṭ ṭayri wa-ūtīnā min kulli shay-ī ۖ inna hādhā lahuwal faḍlul mubīn

ayas.arabic: وَحُشِرَ لِسُلَيْمَـٰنَ جُنُودُهُۥ مِنَ ٱلْجِنِّ وَٱلْإِنسِ وَٱلطَّيْرِ فَهُمْ يُوزَعُونَ
ayas.translation: His armies of jinns and men and Tair assembled, formed into ranks, (and marched)
ayas.transliteration: waḥushira lisulaymāna junūduhu minal jinni wal-insi waṭ ṭayri fahum yūza`ūn

ayas.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَآ أَتَوْا۟ عَلَىٰ وَادِ ٱلنَّمْلِ قَالَتْ نَمْلَةٌ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّمْلُ ٱدْخُلُوا۟ مَسَـٰكِنَكُمْ لَا يَحْطِمَنَّكُمْ سُلَيْمَـٰنُ وَجُنُودُهُۥ وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
ayas.translation: Till they reached the Valley of Naml. Said the lady of Naml: "O Naml, go into your dwellings lest Solomon and his hordes should crush you unawares."
ayas.transliteration: ḥattā idhā ataw `alā wādin namli qālat namlatun yā-ayyuhan namlud-khulū masākinakum lā yaḥṭimannakum sulaymānu wajunūduhu wahum lā yash`urūn

ayas.arabic: فَتَبَسَّمَ ضَاحِكًا مِّن قَوْلِهَا وَقَالَ رَبِّ أَوْزِعْنِىٓ أَنْ أَشْكُرَ نِعْمَتَكَ ٱلَّتِىٓ أَنْعَمْتَ عَلَىَّ وَعَلَىٰ وَٰلِدَىَّ وَأَنْ أَعْمَلَ صَـٰلِحًا تَرْضَىٰهُ وَأَدْخِلْنِى بِرَحْمَتِكَ فِى عِبَادِكَ ٱلصَّـٰلِحِينَ
ayas.translation: (Solomon) smiled, amused at her speech, and said: "O Lord grant me that I should be grateful for the favours You have bestowed on me and my parents, and do good things of Your pleasing; and admit me among Your righteous devotees by Your grace."
ayas.transliteration: fatabassama ḍāḥikan min qawlihā waqāla rabbi awzi`nī an ashkura ni`matakal latī an`amta `alayya wa`alā wālidayya wa-an a`mala ṣāliḥan tarḍāhu wa-adkhilnī biraḥmatika fī `ibādikaṣ ṣāliḥīn

ayas.arabic: وَتَفَقَّدَ ٱلطَّيْرَ فَقَالَ مَا لِىَ لَآ أَرَى ٱلْهُدْهُدَ أَمْ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلْغَآئِبِينَ
ayas.translation: When he reviewed the Tair, he said: "How is it I do not see Hud-hud? Is he absent?
ayas.transliteration: watafaqqadaṭ ṭayra faqāla mā liya lā aral hud-huda am kāna minal ghā-ibīn

ayas.arabic: لَأُعَذِّبَنَّهُۥ عَذَابًا شَدِيدًا أَوْ لَأَا۟ذْبَحَنَّهُۥٓ أَوْ لَيَأْتِيَنِّى بِسُلْطَـٰنٍ مُّبِينٍ
ayas.translation: I will punish him severely, or cut his throat, unless he bring a valid excuse."
ayas.transliteration: la-u`adhhibannahu `adhāban shadīdan aw la-adhbaḥannahu aw laya-tiyannī bisulṭānin mubīn

ayas.arabic: فَمَكَثَ غَيْرَ بَعِيدٍ فَقَالَ أَحَطتُ بِمَا لَمْ تُحِطْ بِهِۦ وَجِئْتُكَ مِن سَبَإٍۭ بِنَبَإٍ يَقِينٍ
ayas.translation: But he was not long in coming, and reported: "I have been around where you have not been. I come from Saba with positive news.
ayas.transliteration: famakatha ghayra ba`īdin faqāla aḥaṭtu bimā lam tuḥiṭ bihi waji-tuka min saba-in binaba-in yaqīn

ayas.arabic: إِنِّى وَجَدتُّ ٱمْرَأَةً تَمْلِكُهُمْ وَأُوتِيَتْ مِن كُلِّ شَىْءٍ وَلَهَا عَرْشٌ عَظِيمٌ
ayas.translation: I found a woman reigning over them, and she has been favoured with everything; and she has a throne that is magnificent.
ayas.transliteration: innī wajadtum-ra-atan tamlikuhum wa-ūtiyat min kulli shay-in walahā `arshun `aẓīm

ayas.arabic: وَجَدتُّهَا وَقَوْمَهَا يَسْجُدُونَ لِلشَّمْسِ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ وَزَيَّنَ لَهُمُ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ أَعْمَـٰلَهُمْ فَصَدَّهُمْ عَنِ ٱلسَّبِيلِ فَهُمْ لَا يَهْتَدُونَ
ayas.translation: I found that she and her people worship the sun in place of God, for Satan has made their deeds look attractive to them and has turned them away from the Path, so they do not find the way
ayas.transliteration: wajadtuhā waqawmahā yasjudūna lishhamsi min dūnillāhi wazayyana lahumush shayṭānu a`mālahum faṣaddahum `anis sabīli fahum lā yahtadūn

ayas.arabic: أَلَّا يَسْجُدُوا۟ لِلَّهِ ٱلَّذِى يُخْرِجُ ٱلْخَبْءَ فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ وَيَعْلَمُ مَا تُخْفُونَ وَمَا تُعْلِنُونَ
ayas.translation: To worship God who brings to light what is hidden in the heavens and the earth, and is cognisant of what you hide and what you disclose.
ayas.transliteration: allā yasjudū lillāhil ladhī yukhrijul khab a fis samāwāti wal-arḍi waya`lamu mā tukhfūna wa mā tu`linūn

ayas.arabic: ٱللَّهُ لَآ إِلَـٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ رَبُّ ٱلْعَرْشِ ٱلْعَظِيمِ ۩
ayas.translation: God: There is no god but He, the Lord of the glorious throne."
ayas.transliteration: allāhu lā ilāha illā huwa rabbul `arshil `aẓīm ۩

ayas.arabic: قَالَ سَنَنظُرُ أَصَدَقْتَ أَمْ كُنتَ مِنَ ٱلْكَـٰذِبِينَ
ayas.translation: (Solomon) said: 'We shall see if you speak the truth or you are a liar.
ayas.transliteration: qāla sananẓuru aṣadaqta am kunta minal kādhibīn

ayas.arabic: ٱذْهَب بِّكِتَـٰبِى هَـٰذَا فَأَلْقِهْ إِلَيْهِمْ ثُمَّ تَوَلَّ عَنْهُمْ فَٱنظُرْ مَاذَا يَرْجِعُونَ
ayas.translation: Take this letter from me, and deliver it to them and withdraw, then see what reply they give in return."
ayas.transliteration: idh-hab bikitābī hādhā fa-alqih ilayhim thumma tawalla `anhum fanẓur mādhā yarji`ūn

ayas.arabic: قَالَتْ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْمَلَؤُا۟ إِنِّىٓ أُلْقِىَ إِلَىَّ كِتَـٰبٌ كَرِيمٌ
ayas.translation: (The Queen said): "O nobles, a venerable letter has been delivered to me.
ayas.transliteration: qālat yā-ayyuhal mala-u innī ulqiya ilayya kitābun karīm

ayas.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ مِن سُلَيْمَـٰنَ وَإِنَّهُۥ بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَـٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ
ayas.translation: It is from Solomon, and (says): 'In the name of Allah, Ar-Rahman, Ar-Rahim.
ayas.transliteration: innahu min sulaymāna wa innahu bismillāhir raḥmānir raḥīm

ayas.arabic: أَلَّا تَعْلُوا۟ عَلَىَّ وَأْتُونِى مُسْلِمِينَ
ayas.translation: Do not rise against me, but come to me in submission.'
ayas.transliteration: allā ta`lū `alayya wa-tūnī muslimīn

ayas.arabic: قَالَتْ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْمَلَؤُا۟ أَفْتُونِى فِىٓ أَمْرِى مَا كُنتُ قَاطِعَةً أَمْرًا حَتَّىٰ تَشْهَدُونِ
ayas.translation: ." Advise me, O nobles," she said "in this matter. I do not decide any thing until you concur."
ayas.transliteration: qālat yā-ayyuhal mala-u aftūnī fī amrī mā kuntu qāṭi`atan amran ḥattā tash-hadūn

ayas.arabic: قَالُوا۟ نَحْنُ أُو۟لُوا۟ قُوَّةٍ وَأُو۟لُوا۟ بَأْسٍ شَدِيدٍ وَٱلْأَمْرُ إِلَيْكِ فَٱنظُرِى مَاذَا تَأْمُرِينَ
ayas.translation: They said: "We are men of valour, and brave fighters. It is for you to decide. So consider what you should command."
ayas.transliteration: qālū naḥnu ulū quwwatin wa-ulū ba-sin shadīdin wal-amru ilayki fanẓurī mādhā ta-murīn

ayas.arabic: قَالَتْ إِنَّ ٱلْمُلُوكَ إِذَا دَخَلُوا۟ قَرْيَةً أَفْسَدُوهَا وَجَعَلُوٓا۟ أَعِزَّةَ أَهْلِهَآ أَذِلَّةً ۖ وَكَذَٰلِكَ يَفْعَلُونَ
ayas.translation: She said: "Surely when kings enter a city they destroy it and despoil the honour of its nobility. So will they do (to us).
ayas.transliteration: qālat innal mulūka idhā dakhalū qaryatan afsadūhā waja`alū a`izzata ahlihā adhillah ۖ wakadhālika yaf`alūn

ayas.arabic: وَإِنِّى مُرْسِلَةٌ إِلَيْهِم بِهَدِيَّةٍ فَنَاظِرَةٌۢ بِمَ يَرْجِعُ ٱلْمُرْسَلُونَ
ayas.translation: But I will send them a gift and see what the envoys bring back (in return)."
ayas.transliteration: wa innī mursilatun ilayhim bihadiyyatin fanāẓiratun bima yarji`ul mursalūn

ayas.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَ سُلَيْمَـٰنَ قَالَ أَتُمِدُّونَنِ بِمَالٍ فَمَآ ءَاتَىٰنِۦَ ٱللَّهُ خَيْرٌ مِّمَّآ ءَاتَىٰكُم بَلْ أَنتُم بِهَدِيَّتِكُمْ تَفْرَحُونَ
ayas.translation: So, when the envoys came to Solomon he said: "Do you wish to increase my wealth? Yet what God has given me is better than what He has given you. No. Be gratified in your present.
ayas.transliteration: falammā jā-a sulaymāna qāla atumiddūnani bimālin famā ātāniyallāhu khayrun mimmā ātākum bal antum bihadiyyatikum tafraḥūn

ayas.arabic: ٱرْجِعْ إِلَيْهِمْ فَلَنَأْتِيَنَّهُم بِجُنُودٍ لَّا قِبَلَ لَهُم بِهَا وَلَنُخْرِجَنَّهُم مِّنْهَآ أَذِلَّةً وَهُمْ صَـٰغِرُونَ
ayas.translation: Go back to them. We shall soon come with our armies which they will not be able to face. We shall drive them out of (the land) with ignominy, and they will be humbled."
ayas.transliteration: irji` ilayhim falana-tiyannahum bijunūdin lā qibala lahum bihā walanukhrijannahum minhā adhillatan wahum ṣāghirūn

ayas.arabic: قَالَ يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلْمَلَؤُا۟ أَيُّكُمْ يَأْتِينِى بِعَرْشِهَا قَبْلَ أَن يَأْتُونِى مُسْلِمِينَ
ayas.translation: He (then) said (to his courtiers): "O you nobles, is there any one who can bring me her throne before they come to me in submission?"
ayas.transliteration: qāla yā-ayyuhal mala-u ayyukum ya-tīnī bi`arshihā qabla an ya-tūnī muslimīn

ayas.arabic: قَالَ عِفْرِيتٌ مِّنَ ٱلْجِنِّ أَنَا۠ ءَاتِيكَ بِهِۦ قَبْلَ أَن تَقُومَ مِن مَّقَامِكَ ۖ وَإِنِّى عَلَيْهِ لَقَوِىٌّ أَمِينٌ
ayas.translation: A crafty jinn said: "I will bring it before you rise from your seat, for I am strong and trustworthy."
ayas.transliteration: qāla `ifrītun minal jinni ana ātīka bihi qabla an taqūma min maqāmik ۖ wa innī `alayhi laqawiyyun amīn

ayas.arabic: قَالَ ٱلَّذِى عِندَهُۥ عِلْمٌ مِّنَ ٱلْكِتَـٰبِ أَنَا۠ ءَاتِيكَ بِهِۦ قَبْلَ أَن يَرْتَدَّ إِلَيْكَ طَرْفُكَ ۚ فَلَمَّا رَءَاهُ مُسْتَقِرًّا عِندَهُۥ قَالَ هَـٰذَا مِن فَضْلِ رَبِّى لِيَبْلُوَنِىٓ ءَأَشْكُرُ أَمْ أَكْفُرُ ۖ وَمَن شَكَرَ فَإِنَّمَا يَشْكُرُ لِنَفْسِهِۦ ۖ وَمَن كَفَرَ فَإِنَّ رَبِّى غَنِىٌّ كَرِيمٌ
ayas.translation: But one who had knowledge of the letter, said: "I will bring it to you in the twinkling of an eye." When Solomon saw it before him, (he said): "This is by the grace of my Lord that He may test me whether I am grateful or I am thankless. Yet if one is grateful, he is grateful for himself, and if one is thankless, then surely my Lord is unconcerned and magnanimous."
ayas.transliteration: qālal ladhī `indahu `il-mun minal kitābi ana ātīka bihi qabla an yartadda ilayka ṭarfuk ۚ falammā ra-āhu mustaqirran `indahu qāla hādhā min faḍli rabbī liyabluwanī a-ashkuru am akfur ۖ wa man shakara fa-innamā yashkuru linafsih ۖ wa man kafara fa-inna rabbī ghaniyyun karīm

ayas.arabic: قَالَ نَكِّرُوا۟ لَهَا عَرْشَهَا نَنظُرْ أَتَهْتَدِىٓ أَمْ تَكُونُ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يَهْتَدُونَ
ayas.translation: (Turning to his nobles) he said: "Change the appearance of her throne. Let us see if she is rightly guided, or is not guided at all."
ayas.transliteration: qāla nakkirū lahā `arshahā nanẓur atahtadī am takūnu minal ladhīna lā yahtadūn

ayas.arabic: فَلَمَّا جَآءَتْ قِيلَ أَهَـٰكَذَا عَرْشُكِ ۖ قَالَتْ كَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ ۚ وَأُوتِينَا ٱلْعِلْمَ مِن قَبْلِهَا وَكُنَّا مُسْلِمِينَ
ayas.translation: When she arrived, they asked her: "Is your throne like this?" She said: "As though this is it. We had come to have knowledge and already submitted."
ayas.transliteration: falammā jā-at qīla ahākadhā `arshuk ۖ qālat ka-annahu huw ۚ wa-ūtīnal `il-ma min qablihā wakunnā muslimīn

ayas.arabic: وَصَدَّهَا مَا كَانَت تَّعْبُدُ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّهَا كَانَتْ مِن قَوْمٍ كَـٰفِرِينَ
ayas.translation: She was (in fact) turned away by what she worshipped other than God, for she came of an unbelieving people.
ayas.transliteration: waṣaddahā mā kānat ta`budu min dūnillāh ۖ innahā kānat min qawmin kāfirīn

ayas.arabic: قِيلَ لَهَا ٱدْخُلِى ٱلصَّرْحَ ۖ فَلَمَّا رَأَتْهُ حَسِبَتْهُ لُجَّةً وَكَشَفَتْ عَن سَاقَيْهَا ۚ قَالَ إِنَّهُۥ صَرْحٌ مُّمَرَّدٌ مِّن قَوَارِيرَ ۗ قَالَتْ رَبِّ إِنِّى ظَلَمْتُ نَفْسِى وَأَسْلَمْتُ مَعَ سُلَيْمَـٰنَ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
ayas.translation: She was invited to enter the court. When she saw it, she took it for a sheet of water, and (pulling up her skirts) uncovered her legs. (Solomon) told her: "This is paved with tiles of glass." "O Lord," she said, "I have wronged myself, and I submit to the Lord of all the worlds with Solomon."
ayas.transliteration: qīla lahad-khuliṣ ṣarḥ ۖ falammā ra-at-hu ḥasibat-hu lujjatan wakashafat `an sāqayhā ۚ qāla innahu ṣarḥun mumarradun min qawārīr ۗ qālat rabbi innī ẓalamtu nafsī wa-aslamtu ma`a sulaymāna lillāhi rabbil `ālamīn

ayas.arabic: وَلَقَدْ أَرْسَلْنَآ إِلَىٰ ثَمُودَ أَخَاهُمْ صَـٰلِحًا أَنِ ٱعْبُدُوا۟ ٱللَّهَ فَإِذَا هُمْ فَرِيقَانِ يَخْتَصِمُونَ
ayas.translation: We sent to Thamud their brother Saleh (who said): "Worship God." But they were divided into two groups disputing with one another.
ayas.transliteration: walaqad arsalnā ilā thamūda akhāhum ṣāliḥan ani'-budullāha fa-idhā hum farīqāni yakhtaṣimūn

ayas.arabic: قَالَ يَـٰقَوْمِ لِمَ تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ بِٱلسَّيِّئَةِ قَبْلَ ٱلْحَسَنَةِ ۖ لَوْلَا تَسْتَغْفِرُونَ ٱللَّهَ لَعَلَّكُمْ تُرْحَمُونَ
ayas.translation: (Saleh) said: "O people, why do you wish to hasten evil rather than good? Why not ask for God's forgiveness? You may well be forgiven."
ayas.transliteration: qāla yāqawmi lima tasta`jilūna bis sayyi-ati qablal-ḥasanah ۖ lawlā tastaghfirūnallāha la`allakum turḥamūn

ayas.arabic: قَالُوا۟ ٱطَّيَّرْنَا بِكَ وَبِمَن مَّعَكَ ۚ قَالَ طَـٰٓئِرُكُمْ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ ۖ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌ تُفْتَنُونَ
ayas.translation: They said: "You betoken evil, and those with you." (Saleh) replied: "The evil you presage can only come from God. In reality you are a people under trial (for your own inauspiciousness)."
ayas.transliteration: qāluṭ-ṭayyarnā bika wabiman ma`ak ۚ qāla ṭā-irukum `indallāh ۖ bal antum qawmun tuftanūn

ayas.arabic: وَكَانَ فِى ٱلْمَدِينَةِ تِسْعَةُ رَهْطٍ يُفْسِدُونَ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَلَا يُصْلِحُونَ
ayas.translation: There were in that city nine persons who spread disorder in the land, and did not reform.
ayas.transliteration: wakāna fil madīnati tis`atu rahṭiy yufsidūna fil-arḍi walā yuṣliḥūn

ayas.arabic: قَالُوا۟ تَقَاسَمُوا۟ بِٱللَّهِ لَنُبَيِّتَنَّهُۥ وَأَهْلَهُۥ ثُمَّ لَنَقُولَنَّ لِوَلِيِّهِۦ مَا شَهِدْنَا مَهْلِكَ أَهْلِهِۦ وَإِنَّا لَصَـٰدِقُونَ
ayas.translation: They said: "Let us swear by God that we will attack Saleh and his family at night, and later tell his heirs: 'We did not see his family destroyed, and we speak the truth.'"
ayas.transliteration: qālū taqāsamū billāhi lanubayyitannahu wa-ahlahu thumma lanaqūlanna liwaliyyihi mā shahidnā mahlika ahlihi wa innā laṣādiqūn

ayas.arabic: وَمَكَرُوا۟ مَكْرًا وَمَكَرْنَا مَكْرًا وَهُمْ لَا يَشْعُرُونَ
ayas.translation: They hatched up the plot; We also planned without their knowledge.
ayas.transliteration: wa makarū makran wa makarnā makran wahum lā yash`urūn

ayas.arabic: فَٱنظُرْ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ مَكْرِهِمْ أَنَّا دَمَّرْنَـٰهُمْ وَقَوْمَهُمْ أَجْمَعِينَ
ayas.translation: Now see the end of their machinations: We destroyed them and their entire people.
ayas.transliteration: fanẓur kayfa kāna `āqibatu makrihim annā dammarnāhum waqawmahum ajma`īn

ayas.arabic: فَتِلْكَ بُيُوتُهُمْ خَاوِيَةًۢ بِمَا ظَلَمُوٓا۟ ۗ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَةً لِّقَوْمٍ يَعْلَمُونَ
ayas.translation: So these their habitations lie deserted now because of their iniquities. Verily there is a sign in this for those who understand.
ayas.transliteration: fatilka buyūtuhum khāwiyatan bimā ẓalamū ۗ inna fī dhālika la-āyatan liqawmiy ya`lamūn

ayas.arabic: وَأَنجَيْنَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوا۟ وَكَانُوا۟ يَتَّقُونَ
ayas.translation: We deliver those who believe and take heed for themselves.
ayas.transliteration: wa-anjaynal ladhīna āmanū wakānū yattaqūn

ayas.arabic: وَلُوطًا إِذْ قَالَ لِقَوْمِهِۦٓ أَتَأْتُونَ ٱلْفَـٰحِشَةَ وَأَنتُمْ تُبْصِرُونَ
ayas.translation: (Remember) Lot, when he said to his people: "Why do you indulge in obscenities when you know (it is evil)?
ayas.transliteration: walūṭan idh qāla liqawmihi ata-tūnal fāḥishata wa-antum tubṣirūn

ayas.arabic: أَئِنَّكُمْ لَتَأْتُونَ ٱلرِّجَالَ شَهْوَةً مِّن دُونِ ٱلنِّسَآءِ ۚ بَلْ أَنتُمْ قَوْمٌ تَجْهَلُونَ
ayas.translation: You lust after men in place of women. You are indeed a stolid people."
ayas.transliteration: a-innakum lata-tūnar rijāla shahwatan min dūnin nisā-i ۚ bal antum qawmun tajhalūn

ayas.arabic: فَمَا كَانَ جَوَابَ قَوْمِهِۦٓ إِلَّآ أَن قَالُوٓا۟ أَخْرِجُوٓا۟ ءَالَ لُوطٍ مِّن قَرْيَتِكُمْ ۖ إِنَّهُمْ أُنَاسٌ يَتَطَهَّرُونَ
ayas.translation: His people had no answer except saying: "Expel the family of Lot from your city. They are a people who would (rather) be pure!"
ayas.transliteration: famā kāna jawāba qawmihi illā an qālū akhrijū āla lūṭin min qaryatikum ۖ innahum unāsun yataṭahharūn

ayas.arabic: فَأَنجَيْنَـٰهُ وَأَهْلَهُۥٓ إِلَّا ٱمْرَأَتَهُۥ قَدَّرْنَـٰهَا مِنَ ٱلْغَـٰبِرِينَ
ayas.translation: So We saved him and his family except his wife who was destined to stay behind.
ayas.transliteration: fa-anjaynāhu wa-ahlahu illam-ra-atahu qaddarnāhā minal ghābirīn

ayas.arabic: وَأَمْطَرْنَا عَلَيْهِم مَّطَرًا ۖ فَسَآءَ مَطَرُ ٱلْمُنذَرِينَ
ayas.translation: And We rained down on them a shower (of stones). How ruinous was the rain that fell on those who had been warned (but warned in vain)!
ayas.transliteration: wa-amṭarnā `alayhim maṭarā ۖ fasā-a maṭarul mundharīn

ayas.arabic: قُلِ ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ وَسَلَـٰمٌ عَلَىٰ عِبَادِهِ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱصْطَفَىٰٓ ۗ ءَآللَّهُ خَيْرٌ أَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
ayas.translation: Say: "All praise be to God, and peace on those of His creatures whom He has chosen." Is God better or those they associate with Him --
ayas.transliteration: qulil ḥamdu lillāhi wasalāmun `alā `ibādihil ladhīnaṣ-ṭafā ۗ ālllāhu khayrun ammā yushrikūn

ayas.arabic: أَمَّنْ خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ وَأَنزَلَ لَكُم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءً فَأَنۢبَتْنَا بِهِۦ حَدَآئِقَ ذَاتَ بَهْجَةٍ مَّا كَانَ لَكُمْ أَن تُنۢبِتُوا۟ شَجَرَهَآ ۗ أَءِلَـٰهٌ مَّعَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ قَوْمٌ يَعْدِلُونَ
ayas.translation: Who created the heavens and the earth, who sends down water from the sky for you, with which He causes graceful gardens to grow? It was not in your power to make trees germinate. Is there any other god along with God. In fact they are a people who turn away (from the truth).
ayas.transliteration: amman khalaqas samāwāti wal-arḍa wa-anzala lakum minas samā-i mā-an fa-anbatnā bihi ḥadā-iqa dhāta bahjatim mā kāna lakum an tunbitū shajarahā ۗ a-ilāhun ma`allāh ۚ bal hum qawmun ya`dilūn

ayas.arabic: أَمَّن جَعَلَ ٱلْأَرْضَ قَرَارًا وَجَعَلَ خِلَـٰلَهَآ أَنْهَـٰرًا وَجَعَلَ لَهَا رَوَٰسِىَ وَجَعَلَ بَيْنَ ٱلْبَحْرَيْنِ حَاجِزًا ۗ أَءِلَـٰهٌ مَّعَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ بَلْ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
ayas.translation: Who then made the earth a habitable place, and made the rivers (flow) in its valleys and dales, and placed upon it firm stabilisers, and kept a barrier between two bodies of water? Is there any other god along with God? In reality most of them do not know.
ayas.transliteration: amman ja`alal-arḍa qarāran waja`ala khilālahā anhāran waja`ala lahā rawāsiya waja`ala baynal baḥrayni ḥājizā ۗ a-ilāhun ma`allāh ۚ bal aktharuhum lā ya`lamūn

ayas.arabic: أَمَّن يُجِيبُ ٱلْمُضْطَرَّ إِذَا دَعَاهُ وَيَكْشِفُ ٱلسُّوٓءَ وَيَجْعَلُكُمْ خُلَفَآءَ ٱلْأَرْضِ ۗ أَءِلَـٰهٌ مَّعَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ قَلِيلًا مَّا تَذَكَّرُونَ
ayas.translation: Who hears the cry of the anguished (soul) when it calls to Him, and relieves its suffering? And who made you trustees on the earth? Is there any other god along with God? How little it is that you reflect!
ayas.transliteration: amman yujībul muḍṭarra idhā da`āhu wayakshifus sū a wayaj`alukum khulafā-al-arḍ ۗ a-ilāhun ma`allāh ۚ qalīlan mā tadhakkarūn

ayas.arabic: أَمَّن يَهْدِيكُمْ فِى ظُلُمَـٰتِ ٱلْبَرِّ وَٱلْبَحْرِ وَمَن يُرْسِلُ ٱلرِّيَـٰحَ بُشْرًۢا بَيْنَ يَدَىْ رَحْمَتِهِۦٓ ۗ أَءِلَـٰهٌ مَّعَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ تَعَـٰلَى ٱللَّهُ عَمَّا يُشْرِكُونَ
ayas.translation: Who then really shows you the way in the darkness of the desert and the sea? And who sends breezes bringing news of His benevolence? Is there any other god along with God? He is far too exalted for what they associate with Him!
ayas.transliteration: amman yahdīkum fī ẓulumātil barri wal baḥri wa man yursilur riyāḥa bushran bayna yaday raḥmatih ۗ a-ilāhun ma`allāh ۚ ta`ālallāhu `ammā yushrikūn

ayas.arabic: أَمَّن يَبْدَؤُا۟ ٱلْخَلْقَ ثُمَّ يُعِيدُهُۥ وَمَن يَرْزُقُكُم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۗ أَءِلَـٰهٌ مَّعَ ٱللَّهِ ۚ قُلْ هَاتُوا۟ بُرْهَـٰنَكُمْ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰدِقِينَ
ayas.translation: Who creates first then reverts it? And who gives you provision from the heavens and the earth? Is there any other god along with God? Tell them: "Bring your proof, if you are truthful."
ayas.transliteration: amman yabda-ul khalqa thumma yu`īduhu wa man yarzuqukum minas samā-i wal-arḍ ۗ a-ilāhun ma`allāh ۚ qul hātū burhānakum in kuntum ṣādiqīn

ayas.arabic: قُل لَّا يَعْلَمُ مَن فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ٱلْغَيْبَ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ ۚ وَمَا يَشْعُرُونَ أَيَّانَ يُبْعَثُونَ
ayas.translation: Say: "No one in the heavens and the earth has knowledge of the unknown except God, nor can they know when they will be raised again.
ayas.transliteration: qul lā ya`lamu man fis samāwāti wal-arḍil ghayba illallāh ۚ wa mā yash`urūna ayyāna yub`athūn

ayas.arabic: بَلِ ٱدَّٰرَكَ عِلْمُهُمْ فِى ٱلْـَٔاخِرَةِ ۚ بَلْ هُمْ فِى شَكٍّ مِّنْهَا ۖ بَلْ هُم مِّنْهَا عَمُونَ
ayas.translation: Still less do they comprehend the life to come. In fact they are in doubt about it. Still more, they are blind to it."
ayas.transliteration: balid-dāraka `il-muhum fil-ākhirah ۚ bal hum fī shakkin minhā ۖ bal hum minhā `amūn

ayas.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُوٓا۟ أَءِذَا كُنَّا تُرَٰبًا وَءَابَآؤُنَآ أَئِنَّا لَمُخْرَجُونَ
ayas.translation: Those who do not believe, say: "When we and our fathers have turned to dust, how shall we be raised again?
ayas.transliteration: waqālal ladhīna kafarū a-idhā kunnā turāban wa-ābā-unā a-innā lamukhrajūn

ayas.arabic: لَقَدْ وُعِدْنَا هَـٰذَا نَحْنُ وَءَابَآؤُنَا مِن قَبْلُ إِنْ هَـٰذَآ إِلَّآ أَسَـٰطِيرُ ٱلْأَوَّلِينَ
ayas.translation: Indeed we and our fathers had been promised this before. It is nothing but the earlier people's lore."
ayas.transliteration: laqad wu`idnā hādhā naḥnu wa-ābā-unā min qablu in hādhā illā asāṭīrul-awwalīn

ayas.arabic: قُلْ سِيرُوا۟ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ فَٱنظُرُوا۟ كَيْفَ كَانَ عَـٰقِبَةُ ٱلْمُجْرِمِينَ
ayas.translation: Say: "Travel in the land and see how (bad) was the end of sinners."
ayas.transliteration: qul sīrū fil-arḍi fanẓurū kayfa kāna `āqibatul mujrimīn

ayas.arabic: وَلَا تَحْزَنْ عَلَيْهِمْ وَلَا تَكُن فِى ضَيْقٍ مِّمَّا يَمْكُرُونَ
ayas.translation: Do not grieve over them, and do not be distressed by what they contrive.
ayas.transliteration: walā taḥzan `alayhim walā takun fī ḍayqin mimmā yamkurūn

ayas.arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَـٰذَا ٱلْوَعْدُ إِن كُنتُمْ صَـٰدِقِينَ
ayas.translation: Yet they say: "When will this promise come to pass? (Tell Us) if you speak the truth."
ayas.transliteration: wayaqūlūna matā hādhal wa`du in kuntum ṣādiqīn

ayas.arabic: قُلْ عَسَىٰٓ أَن يَكُونَ رَدِفَ لَكُم بَعْضُ ٱلَّذِى تَسْتَعْجِلُونَ
ayas.translation: Say: "Perhaps some of what you wish to hasten is right behind you."
ayas.transliteration: qul `asā an yakūna radifa lakum ba`ḍul ladhī tasta`jilūn

ayas.arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَذُو فَضْلٍ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ وَلَـٰكِنَّ أَكْثَرَهُمْ لَا يَشْكُرُونَ
ayas.translation: Verily your Lord is gracious to men, though most men are ungrateful.
ayas.transliteration: wa inna rabbaka ladhū faḍlin `alan nāsi walākinna aktharahum lā yashkurūn

ayas.arabic: وَإِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَيَعْلَمُ مَا تُكِنُّ صُدُورُهُمْ وَمَا يُعْلِنُونَ
ayas.translation: Verily your Lord knows what lies hidden in their breasts and what they disclose.
ayas.transliteration: wa inna rabbaka laya`lamu mā tukinnu ṣudūruhum wa mā yu`linūn

ayas.arabic: وَمَا مِنْ غَآئِبَةٍ فِى ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ إِلَّا فِى كِتَـٰبٍ مُّبِينٍ
ayas.translation: There is nothing of the hidden in the heavens and the earth that is not recorded in the luminous Book.
ayas.transliteration: wa mā min ghā-ibatin fis samā-i wal-arḍi illā fī kitābin mubīn

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ هَـٰذَا ٱلْقُرْءَانَ يَقُصُّ عَلَىٰ بَنِىٓ إِسْرَٰٓءِيلَ أَكْثَرَ ٱلَّذِى هُمْ فِيهِ يَخْتَلِفُونَ
ayas.translation: Indeed this Qur'an explains to the children of Israel much of what they are at variance.
ayas.transliteration: inna hādhal qur-āna yaquṣṣu `alā banī isrā-iyla aktharal ladhī hum fīhi yakhtalifūn

ayas.arabic: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَهُدًى وَرَحْمَةٌ لِّلْمُؤْمِنِينَ
ayas.translation: It is a guidance and grace for those who believe.
ayas.transliteration: wa innahu lahudan waraḥmatun lil-mu-minīn

ayas.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَقْضِى بَيْنَهُم بِحُكْمِهِۦ ۚ وَهُوَ ٱلْعَزِيزُ ٱلْعَلِيمُ
ayas.translation: Surely your Lord in His wisdom will decide between them. He is all-mighty and all-knowing.
ayas.transliteration: inna rabbaka yaqḍī baynahum biḥukmih ۚ wahuwal `azīzul `alīm

ayas.arabic: فَتَوَكَّلْ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّكَ عَلَى ٱلْحَقِّ ٱلْمُبِينِ
ayas.translation: So you place your trust in God. Certainly you stand on positive truth.
ayas.transliteration: fatawakkal `alallāh ۖ innaka `alal-ḥaqqil mubīn

ayas.arabic: إِنَّكَ لَا تُسْمِعُ ٱلْمَوْتَىٰ وَلَا تُسْمِعُ ٱلصُّمَّ ٱلدُّعَآءَ إِذَا وَلَّوْا۟ مُدْبِرِينَ
ayas.translation: You cannot make the dead to listen, or the deaf to hear the call, when they have turned their backs,
ayas.transliteration: innaka lā tusmi`ul mawtā walā tusmi`uṣ ṣummad du`ā-a idhā wallaw mudbirīn

ayas.arabic: وَمَآ أَنتَ بِهَـٰدِى ٱلْعُمْىِ عَن ضَلَـٰلَتِهِمْ ۖ إِن تُسْمِعُ إِلَّا مَن يُؤْمِنُ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا فَهُم مُّسْلِمُونَ
ayas.translation: Nor can you lead the blind when they have gone astray. You can make none hear except those who believe in Our signs and have come to peace and submission.
ayas.transliteration: wa mā anta bihādil `umyi `an ḍalālatihim ۖ in tusmi`u illā man yu-minu bi-āyātinā fahum muslimūn

ayas.arabic: وَإِذَا وَقَعَ ٱلْقَوْلُ عَلَيْهِمْ أَخْرَجْنَا لَهُمْ دَآبَّةً مِّنَ ٱلْأَرْضِ تُكَلِّمُهُمْ أَنَّ ٱلنَّاسَ كَانُوا۟ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا لَا يُوقِنُونَ
ayas.translation: When the sentence will have been passed against them, We shall bring forth beastly brutes from the earth who will torment them, for men certainly do not believe Our signs.
ayas.transliteration: wa idhā waqa`al qawlu `alayhim akhrajnā lahum dābbatan minal-arḍi tukallimuhum annan nāsa kānū bi-āyātinā lā yūqinūn

ayas.arabic: وَيَوْمَ نَحْشُرُ مِن كُلِّ أُمَّةٍ فَوْجًا مِّمَّن يُكَذِّبُ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَا فَهُمْ يُوزَعُونَ
ayas.translation: The day We shall gather from every community a section of those who denied Our signs, and they will be brought (in separate groups),
ayas.transliteration: wayawma naḥshuru min kulli ummatin fawjan mimman yukadhhibu bi-āyātinā fahum yūza`ūn

ayas.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا جَآءُو قَالَ أَكَذَّبْتُم بِـَٔايَـٰتِى وَلَمْ تُحِيطُوا۟ بِهَا عِلْمًا أَمَّاذَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
ayas.translation: So that when they come (before the Lord) He will say: "Did you deny My signs without having understood them? Or what was it that you were doing?"
ayas.transliteration: ḥattā idhā jā-ū qāla akadhhabtum bi-āyātī walam tuḥīṭū bihā `il-man ammādhā kuntum ta`malūn

ayas.arabic: وَوَقَعَ ٱلْقَوْلُ عَلَيْهِم بِمَا ظَلَمُوا۟ فَهُمْ لَا يَنطِقُونَ
ayas.translation: When the sentence will have been passed upon them for their wickedness, they will not be able to say a word.
ayas.transliteration: wawaqa`al qawlu `alayhim bimā ẓalamū fahum lā yanṭiqūn

ayas.arabic: أَلَمْ يَرَوْا۟ أَنَّا جَعَلْنَا ٱلَّيْلَ لِيَسْكُنُوا۟ فِيهِ وَٱلنَّهَارَ مُبْصِرًا ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍ لِّقَوْمٍ يُؤْمِنُونَ
ayas.translation: Do they not see that We made the night for them to rest, the day to make things clear? Indeed there are signs in this for people who believe.
ayas.transliteration: alam yaraw annā ja`alnal layla liyaskunū fīhi wan nahāra mubṣirā ۚ inna fī dhālika la-āyātin liqawmiy yu-minūn

ayas.arabic: وَيَوْمَ يُنفَخُ فِى ٱلصُّورِ فَفَزِعَ مَن فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَن فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ إِلَّا مَن شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ ۚ وَكُلٌّ أَتَوْهُ دَٰخِرِينَ
ayas.translation: The day the trumpet blast is sounded whoever is in the heavens and the earth will be terrified, save those whom God please, and all will appear before Him in abjectness.
ayas.transliteration: wayawma yunfakhu fiṣ ṣūri fafazi`a man fis samāwāti wa man fil-arḍi illā man shā-allāh ۚ wakullun atawhu dākhirīn

ayas.arabic: وَتَرَى ٱلْجِبَالَ تَحْسَبُهَا جَامِدَةً وَهِىَ تَمُرُّ مَرَّ ٱلسَّحَابِ ۚ صُنْعَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلَّذِىٓ أَتْقَنَ كُلَّ شَىْءٍ ۚ إِنَّهُۥ خَبِيرٌۢ بِمَا تَفْعَلُونَ
ayas.translation: You will see the mountains and think they are firmly planted, but they will pass away like flying clouds: Artistry of God who perfected everything. He is indeed fully aware of what you do.
ayas.transliteration: wataral jibāla taḥsabuhā jāmidatan wahiya tamurru marras saḥāb ۚ ṣun`allāhil ladhī atqana kulla shay-ī ۚ innahu khabīrun bimā taf`alūn

ayas.arabic: مَن جَآءَ بِٱلْحَسَنَةِ فَلَهُۥ خَيْرٌ مِّنْهَا وَهُم مِّن فَزَعٍ يَوْمَئِذٍ ءَامِنُونَ
ayas.translation: Whoever comes with good (deeds) will receive better than (what he had done), and be safe that day from terror.
ayas.transliteration: man jā-a bil ḥasanati falahu khayrun minhā wahum min faza`iy yawma-idhin āminūn

ayas.arabic: وَمَن جَآءَ بِٱلسَّيِّئَةِ فَكُبَّتْ وُجُوهُهُمْ فِى ٱلنَّارِ هَلْ تُجْزَوْنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
ayas.translation: But whosoever comes with evil will be flung face forward into the Fire. Can you expect reward for any thing but what you do?
ayas.transliteration: wa man jā-a bis sayyi-ati fakubbat wujūhuhum fin nāri hal tujzawna illā mā kuntum ta`malūn

ayas.arabic: إِنَّمَآ أُمِرْتُ أَنْ أَعْبُدَ رَبَّ هَـٰذِهِ ٱلْبَلْدَةِ ٱلَّذِى حَرَّمَهَا وَلَهُۥ كُلُّ شَىْءٍ ۖ وَأُمِرْتُ أَنْ أَكُونَ مِنَ ٱلْمُسْلِمِينَ
ayas.translation: (Say): "I am commanded to worship the Lord of this land He has blessed, to whom all things belong; and I am commanded to be one of those who submit,
ayas.transliteration: innamā umirtu an a`buda rabba hādhihil baldatil ladhī ḥarramahā walahu kullu shay-ī ۖ wa-umirtu an akūna minal muslimīn

ayas.arabic: وَأَنْ أَتْلُوَا۟ ٱلْقُرْءَانَ ۖ فَمَنِ ٱهْتَدَىٰ فَإِنَّمَا يَهْتَدِى لِنَفْسِهِۦ ۖ وَمَن ضَلَّ فَقُلْ إِنَّمَآ أَنَا۠ مِنَ ٱلْمُنذِرِينَ
ayas.translation: And to recite the Qur'an." Whoever comes to guidance does so for himself; as for him who stays astray, tell him: "I am only a warner."
ayas.transliteration: wa-an atluwal qur-ān ۖ famanih-tadā fa-innamā yahtadī linafsih ۖ wa man ḍalla faqul innamā ana minal mundhirīn

ayas.arabic: وَقُلِ ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ سَيُرِيكُمْ ءَايَـٰتِهِۦ فَتَعْرِفُونَهَا ۚ وَمَا رَبُّكَ بِغَـٰفِلٍ عَمَّا تَعْمَلُونَ
ayas.translation: Say: "All praise be to God. He will show you His signs, and you will recognise them. Your Lord is not heedless of what you do."
ayas.transliteration: waqulil ḥamdu lillāhi sayurīkum āyātihi fata`rifūnahā ۚ wa mā rabbuka bighāfilin `ammā ta`malūn
